edu.umass.cs.sensors.falcon.model
Class TemporalModel

java.lang.Object
  edu.umass.cs.sensors.falcon.model.TemporalModel

public class TemporalModel
extends Object

Implementation of Temporal Model used in APPM algorithm.

The temporal model used in APPM is a fairly simple model that maintains the cumulative distribution functions of duration of gaps between two consecutive events (called TTU). For each event e being modeled, we store i) cumulative distribution of gap duration between e and the event that precedes e, and ii) cumulative distribution of gap duration between e and the second predecessor event of e. These distributions are stored for each event in a corresponding instance of EventTTUMonitor class. TemporalModel class is a wrapper class that simply manages the mapping between event e and its distribution EventTTUMonitor.

Multiple models for various periods of day

Since the distribution of events can vary according to the time of the day, we allow a model to be created for each period of the day. The number of equi-length periods can be specified in the constructor of this class. For example, setting this number to 6 will create a unique model for each 24/6 = 4 hours period of the day.

Computing Likelihood of Event to occur in time interval Δ

If we know the cumulative distribution function FTTU|e, then the likelihood of e to occur within time interval Δ is FTTU|e(Δ). If the probability of e to occur next is p(e) then the likelihood can be corrected as p(e) × FTTU|e(Δ). We extend this approach for the case when we know the probability of e to occur as second next event and use CDF of gap between e and the second preceding event before it to compute likelihood.

Refer to our paper for more details:
Abhinav Parate, Matthias Böhmer, David Chu, Deepak Ganesan, Benjamin Marlin, Practical Prediction and Prefetch for Faster Access to Applications on Mobile phones, Proceedings of the 2013 ACM Conference on Ubiquitous Computing (UbiComp 2013)

Author:
Abhinav Parate, aparate@cs.umass.edu
